body:
Comment 5: 
The spec says:

"Built-in functions are predeclared. They are called like any other function but some of
them accept a type instead of an expression as the first argument.

The built-in functions do not have standard Go types, so they can only appear in call
expressions; they cannot be used as function values."

Since "They are called like any other function" one would expect this to work. My
intention was to fix it for go/types. That said, it's never been an issue in real code
and pretty unimportant. We do have the choice to add another exception to the 2nd
sentence to document the status quo. I'd find that somewhat unfortunate but I don't feel
strongly about it at the moment.
